newsitem.title: UK: IGC leaves 96 world wheat crop estimate unchanged.
newsitem.headline: IGC leaves 96 world wheat crop estimate unchanged.

text.p: The International Grains Council on Thursday pegged the 1996 world wheat crop at 580 million tonnes, unchanged from its previous estimate of a month ago.
In its monthly Grain Market Report, the IGC estimated 1995 production at 540 million tonnes.
However, the unchanged overall figure for 1996 concealed some changes in individual countries' output, the IGC's figures showed.

It raised estimated production in the Commonwealth of Independent States by 500,000 tonnes to 63.8 million tonnes. All of the rise is in "other CIS" countries, with no changes in the big producers -- Russia, Kazakhstan and Ukraine.
It raised its estimate for Brazil's production by 200,000 tonnes to 3.2 million tonnes. And Algeria and Ethiopia both benefitted from a 300,000 increase in their respective estimates.
But the estimate for Iraq's output was cut by 400,000 tonnes to 1.0 million.
